Title: Oh Mylanta
Content:
Iâ€™m trying to stop overthinking things so much. It causes me to be stuck and never make a decision.
Iâ€™m going to call this diary Oh Mylanta because itâ€™s the very first thing that popped into my head and so Iâ€™m rolling with it.
Otherwise I would sit there for an hour thinking of a name that was cool and had meaning, was funny, but not too funny, and reflects who I am but not so much that people might know who I am and so on and so forth. Then I would finally pick a name just to talk myself out of it, and then the diary would never get started.
This is something I do to myself all the time. All the time.
I know why I do this. I do it because my mother is a narcissistic abuser, and every time I did anything, she found something wrong with it. Not just a little bit wrong, but something devastatingly wrong. Iâ€™ll do it better next time. Iâ€™ll do it better next time.
â€œBetter next timeâ€ translates into how she likes it. It took me years to realize there was no way to ever achieve that, because my mother is very sick. An example of this is cleaning. Mom used to cry all the time because the house was so dirty. So I, a child, would try to clean it up. But inevitably, because I was a child, I did something wrong. I threw away important papers. One time she yelled at me for tossing a cup filled with vodka down the sink. When I told her through tears that I thought it was water, she screamed SMELL IT NEXT TIME and stormed off crying.
Iâ€™ve learned through therapy and books about CPTSD that growing up this way trained my brain in a backwards way. Because completing tasks often ended in negative emotions, my brain now does whatever it can to protect me from that, by paralyzing me from making decisions. If I donâ€™t make a decision, then I canâ€™t make the wrong one and get yelled at.
So, here I am!
My name is OhMylanta.
Iâ€™m a 35 year old wife and new mother in Southern California.
I love my life and Iâ€™m very happy. I love my home. I love my husband. I love my son. I love myself.
Iâ€™m going to allow myself to use this diary to write whatever I want whenever I want to. Iâ€™ve been scared to start a diary because any time that I have, itâ€™s been used against me somehow. But, at the suggestion of my therapist, and literally everyone all the time, Iâ€™ve started journaling. My journals are scattered. I use googleDocs sometimes, and sometimes I write in a notebook, and sometimes I use VoiceMemo on my phone. I do this because Iâ€™m scared to put it all in one place, because Iâ€™m scared people will judge me.
Because of the abuse Iâ€™ve endured my entire life, I have emotional struggles. Some of them are very ugly. Sometimes I have really angry, mean thoughtsâ€“even rage. Iâ€™m scared to put my angry thoughts next to my happy thoughts. Iâ€™m scared that if anyone ever reads it, they will think Iâ€™m a bad person for feeling so angry. This programming is from my mother. Whenever I was angry at her for neglecting and abusing me, I was punished. I was not allowed to express anger in any way, ever. Also, my thoughts are quite scattered sometimes, and Iâ€™m scared if anyone reads my scattered thoughts they will think Iâ€™m crazy.
I know that anger is healthy, now. And I know that Iâ€™m not crazy.
Being angry and fragmented is all a part of being a survivor. Itâ€™s okay, and writing down my angry and/or scattered thoughts next to my healthy and happy ones is okay, too. When I get the crazy/angry thoughts out of my head, they donâ€™t plague my mind anymore and I can function so much better. When I donâ€™t, they go round and round and round in my head for days and days and even wake me up sometimes, so itâ€™s imperative that I release them.
Having one place for all my thoughts will be so much easier. I realized that by having multiple places to write, I end up not doing it sometimes because I canâ€™t decide where to do it. This is a self-sabotaging thing I do to myself to keep myself paralyzed. If I commit to writing here, no matter what, I canâ€™t get in my own way anymore.
So, congratulations to me on my new diary!
Hereâ€™s to the future, and to the past, and everything in between.
I encourage anyone who wants to, to follow me on this journey! I encourage anyone who wants to, to comment so we can have fun and healthy discussion, and potentially grow together! ğŸ™‚
Â 
Until next time,
OhMylanta

Title: A beautiful, regular day
Content:
I had a beautiful day today! The most beautiful part is that nothing particularly special happened, but Iâ€™m still so very happy. I finally feel consistent peace and satisfaction, joy even.
I love my son so much. We have a nice routine. My husband is so supportive and kind. He offered to let me sleep in today but I chose to get up with them anyways, because the mornings are just so lovely. Michael makes us coffee and we laugh and giggle with the baby. He drinks his bottle and then an hour later he eats his breakfast of baby yogurt. He loves it. Then we all play a little bit until the boy gets tired and we take a nap together while Dad works.
Iâ€™ve always been a nap person. I need a lot of extra sleep because of my health conditions. Taking naps with my almost 6 month old son is the greatest feeling in the entire world. Sometimes I barely sleep and I just stare at his beautiful face. He knows itâ€™s nap time when get into the big bed together and he rests his little head on my chest and falls right asleep. Today he was having a little nightmare and started whimpering while he slept, and I just hugged him tighter and said, â€œItâ€™s okay, baby. Itâ€™s okay.â€ He opened his eyes and his expression softened and he went right back to sleep.
After we nap, we get up and have another bottle. I tidy the house before I give him lunch.
Ah, jeez I just remembered I need to be cleaning the studio for my clients tomorrow so Iâ€™ll have to wrap this up.
Anyhow, I love being a mother so much. I also love being a wife.
A thought that crosses my mind a lot lately is that I almost missed out on all of this happiness and love. Because I was parentified and abused as a child, I had decided early on that I didnâ€™t want children. I wanted to live my life for me for a change. I felt I had already raised childrenâ€“my sistersâ€“and taken care of my mother my while life. My momâ€™s abuse has robbed me of so much, but itâ€™s insane to think that she mightâ€™ve even robbed me of this beautiful experience that I was made for! I see so much mom content online with these stressed out women making jokes about how awful and thankless being a mother is and it makes me so sad. I canâ€™t relate at all. I love every single second of it, even the hard parts. I donâ€™t resent being â€œstuckâ€ with the baby, because I really lived a full and exciting life through my 20s. I went everywhere and did everything and I experienced so much before my son came along. Being home with him is something I absolutely love. I treasure it because I know it wonâ€™t always be this way. Heâ€™ll be off to school before we know it and becoming more and more independent. Iâ€™m so excited to travel with him and go on adventures, showing him all the places Iâ€™ve been and discovering new ones together. Iâ€™m so excited to watch him grow and discover his interests. What a beautiful existence!

Title: Mourning the Sisters I Never Had
Content:
The last two days have been really hard.
Iâ€™m reading a narcissistic abuse memoir called Believing Me by Ingrid Clayton.
I thought that I would be comforted by reading someone elseâ€™s experience, or maybe less lonelyâ€“gain more insight. Iâ€™m on a quest right now to find out as much information about everything as I possibly can, in the hopes of becoming less and less confused. I want to fully understand perfectly. Iâ€™ve been so confused for my whole life. Every part of my life up until now has been covered in a weird fog. I though thatâ€™s just how life is. Shrouded in mystery and at times filled with nonsense. I thought that part of life was just accepting that things never make sense, and just rolling with it.
I was enthralled by the book until I got about half way through when something weird happened. I started getting angry and jealous.
I was angry because her trauma story is less traumatic than mine. I felt shame for feeling that anger because I would never wish anyone to have more hurt. I felt it was immature and childish of me to compare stories.
But even worse was the jealousy. I was jealous because she still managed to come out of it extremely successful. Her abuser paid for her to go to Berkelee in Boston. Fucking Berklee College of Music. Paid for.
When I was 15 I was walking my ass in feet of snow to the McDonaldâ€™s at 16 and Mound to make $5.50 an hour so I could give my mom money to help with the bills. One time we were arguing about money because I had given her $20 and she was drunk as usual. I said something like â€œhow do you have money for vodka?â€ And she said â€œOh, itâ€™s barely $10 a week,â€ which was bullshit anyways. But it felt like I was going to work to help her to NOT take care of me or my sisters. She would just lay on the couch wasted, our filthy apartment filled with moldy pots and dirty towels. I remember her response clear as day. â€œDonâ€™t I get to have something for myself?â€ she asked through sobs. My mother was always sobbing. Not crying. Sobbing. Boo-hoo, shoulder bouncing sobs. I donâ€™t remember a lot of tears from her, just sobs. I can hear the sound of it even now as I type.
Donâ€™t I get to have something for myself?
The fucked up thing about it is that it worked. I immediately felt awful. Mama works so hard and has been through so much and she deserves to have something for herself, and that something was her precious vodka. I didnâ€™t know at the time that could have been literally anything elseâ€“painting, baking, writing, literally any kind of hobby. I didnâ€™t think of it at the time because Iâ€™d only had a job for a few months and I was barely 15 years old, but why didnâ€™t she have work friends? Iâ€™ve never had job where I didnâ€™t have at least one co-worker friend.
When I was 18 I moved out as fast as I could because my mom used to sob all night long and one of the reasons was that she didnâ€™t have her own bedroom. Sheâ€™d say, â€œHow can I be happy when I donâ€™t even have my own space?â€ So I thought if I moved out, she could have my bedroom. Do you know what she did? She filled my room with shit and kept sleeping on the couch. I also found out later that she told my sisters Iâ€™d just left them there, abandoned them. I moved out thinking it would make my mom happier so she could be a better mom to the girls and she used that as a new reason why she was so depressed and dysfunctional. They still resent me for that to this day.
So of course because I was just a teenager with literally no money and no life skills, I eventually dropped out of college. I couldnâ€™t afford it. I worked all night and then went to school all day and had to do homework every moment between that. I didnâ€™t sleep. I used to take that gas station speed truckers take. I remember they were called Yellow Jackets. Of course the bottom was bound to fall out. Meanwhile the author of this book is going to Berklee for free. She said it was devastating because her step father set her and her brother up in one of his condos and didnâ€™t make himâ€“the golden childâ€“pay rent. She didnâ€™t even have to find a place to live. She just had a place ready to go. God fucking damn it. Oh, you didnâ€™t have to pay for music college and your step dad set you up with a condo but only made one of you pay rent? How tragic.Â I hate myself for thinking such ugly thoughts.
I was even more jealous though because she and her siblings were still bonded and could talk to each other about their abuse. When her abuser was abusive, she could talk to her brothers about it and they would be like, â€œugh, that asshole! Iâ€™m so sorry.â€
I donâ€™t have that. My sisters hate me. My youngest sister hasnâ€™t spoken to me in almost a year and a half and my middle sister has been stonewalling me for years until a few weeks ago when I finally got the balls to ask her why, and sheâ€™s finally taken the leap to the silent treatment.
When I lost my father that was the biggest pain I had ever known. I loved him so much. He was the only person on this planet who listened to me, who offered advice, and called it straight. He was the only person in the whole world who understood me.
But losing my sisters hurts worse somehow. It hurts worse because theyâ€™re not dead. Theyâ€™re alive and well and just fine carrying on without me, without knowing my son. I think about them every day.
What Iâ€™m realizing more and more recently is that the relationship I thought I had with them never actually existed, so in a way, Iâ€™m actually mourning the sisters I never had. I thought they could see me for who I really am, but they canâ€™t and they never did. Mom blamed me for her behavior since they were little, much like how she blamed Dad for her behavior when I was little. Once he wasnâ€™t around anymore to blame, the target fell on me. Theyâ€™ve been brainwashed just like I was brainwashed. Theyâ€™re cruel just like mother is cruel.
And so thatâ€™s why Iâ€™m jealous of the author.
I wish I had escaped with a top tier college degree and my relationship to my sisters in tact, but I have nothing to show. Just bad decision after bad decision. Mistake after mistake.

Title: Dear Sadie
Content:
Dear Sadie,
I have to write this letter to my diary because youâ€™re not speaking to me right now.
I love you so much. I wish that you would let me love you, but over the years it seems like the harder I try the farther away it pushes you.
Itâ€™s been clear to me for several years that you donâ€™t like me very much. I get the very strong feeling that my presence must be tolerated by you, and is far from enjoyed. Your responses when we speak are superficial. A lot of â€œmmhmmâ€ and â€œ..yeah.â€ You roll your eyes when Iâ€™m talking. At times I see you look away in disgust out of the corner of my eye.
This is in very stark contrast to how you act towards our other sister, Jamie. You light up when sheâ€™s around. At Christmas time you snuggle with her and laugh. I used to chalk this off to the simple fact that youâ€™re closer in age and just have a tighter bond. I tried to be respectful and not take it personally, but it still hurt tremendously.
I donâ€™t know why you treat me this way, and you wonâ€™t tell me, so all I can do is speculate. And speculate I do, for hours, all the time, sometimes every day, trying to solve the puzzle, trying desperately to find the solution so I can solve the problem and earn your love. I try to mend whatâ€™s been broken, even though I donâ€™t know what that is, and with each effort I feel your resentment grow.
I had a lot of anger when we were children, and I imagine that was scary for you to see as a child. I had a lot of anger because I was being abused. We were being abused, but specifically I was being deeply abused, and had been since I was born. Mom told me things from a very young age that no child should hear, bad, scary things. She screamed at me all the time, often times because of things that you and Jamie did. When you girls misbehaved, I got the brunt of Momâ€™s rage. She said I was the oldest, I should have been watching you. As a child, I didnâ€™t know any better, so I internalized this. This is why you perceive me as being bossy. I was trained that you were my responsibility, and. your mistakes were my mistakes.
It mad me really confused, scared, and angry that when you misbehaved, I was the one who got in trouble.
Mom also invalidated my feelings constantly. If one of you did something intentionally to hurt me, Mom would brush it off and say you didnâ€™t know better. â€œTheyâ€™re just little,â€ she would say. What she should have been doing was teaching us conflict resolution. â€œHugging it outâ€ doesnâ€™t get to the root of the problem. It doesnâ€™t fix anything, or truly resolve anything. Itâ€™s confusing. It doesnâ€™t feel good. The truth is that Mom just didnâ€™t want to deal with anything, so she put the brunt of that responsibility on me, and when I failed, or when you failed, I got severely punished. How could we ever form a proper sibling relationship under these conditions? You resented me for acting like your parent when I wasnâ€™t, and I resented you for being my responsibility when I should have been enjoying being a child.
Starting about age 7, Mom would have â€œnight talksâ€ with me. It was our special time. During these talksâ€“often she was drunkâ€“Mom would talk to me for hours about very adult matters. She treated me like a confidante. She told me it was because I was an old soul and we had a â€œspecial bond.â€ This is called grooming. Mom wrapped her inappropriate behavior in a pretty bow and called it love. This was very confusing for me as a child, because I wanted her love and affection, but these â€œspecial talksâ€ left me feeling yucky and empty inside.
As a teenager, when Dad was out of the picture, Mom treated me like something akin to a partner, not a daughter. This is a form of child abuse called emotional incest, or enmeshment. I encourage you to watch some videos about it on YouTube to learn more about it, because I canâ€™t even begin to explain the complexities of this type of psychological abuse here in this letter. In addition to this, Mom consistently made me feel like an unbearable burden, which caused me to focus all my attention on alleviating that burden. Thatâ€™s why I went to work as soon as I was 15. It was my little checks from McDonaldâ€™s that kept the lights and the heat on.
Mom also obliterated my self esteem consistently. It made her feel better to make me feel bad. She wanted her pain to be my pain.
She taught us how to lie. Do you remember that? She taught us that omitting parts of the truth meant you were still telling the truth. She taught us to lie about what was going on at home. She did this in a general sense several ways, by allowing us to live in filth, a kitchen filled with gnats, our bedrooms so filled with trash and toys that you couldnâ€™t see the floor. Do you remember that we couldnâ€™t use the front door at the house on Lombardy because there was a pile of laundry blocking the door for an entire year? Living like that teaches a child over time that theyâ€™re worthless. Even worse, when one of us tried to clean, Mom would punish us. One time I cleaned the entire kitchen by myself when I was only 10 years old, and rather than praise, Mom started sob-screaming, saying I had thrown out her cup of vodka, and instructing me to smell it next time. She told a 10 year old child to smell cups before cleaning them to make sure they werenâ€™t coveted alcohol. Her cup of vodka was more important than anything else in that moment. I remember you cleaned the kitchen table one time, and she lost her shit saying you ruined her â€œorganized chaosâ€ as she called it. That table was covered in a mound of dusty papers and envelopes, so we couldnâ€™t sit at the kitchen table, and she yelled at you.
The point that Iâ€™m trying to make is that Mom and I arenâ€™t â€œlike oil and waterâ€ as you once called it. Mom was abusing me, and because of that I had a lot of pent up anger.
Iâ€™m so sorry that you were exposed to that.
I imagine that you hate me for calling child protective services that afternoon. I donâ€™t know how much you remember about that moment, but I remember it like it happened yesterday. The three of us had locked ourselves in my room because Mom was wasted and she was banging on the door screaming. We were terrified. I remember the look of fear on your faces. I looked at you both and I said, â€œI can call for help, but it means we might not see each other for a long time. We might have to go away. Is that something youâ€™re okay with?â€ And you both said yes. Jamie was crying. So I made the call.
Youâ€™ve said before that I just went off and hung out with my friends, but thatâ€™s not what happened. I have a feeling that Mom has something to do with this line of thought. See, Mom canâ€™t ever be accountable for anything. She has no ability for self reflection. She has to blame others all the time for all her mistakes. She told you girls that I did a bad, bad thing by calling that day. And to add to that pain, I was just off galavanting around with my friends while you suffered at the group home.
Thatâ€™s not true.
I was only a child. I was an abused child calling for help. The pain of that experience was so great that I was suicidal for a period of time. I was a lost, abused, broken child living in a home that was not my own. Weâ€™ve never spoken about our experiences. I wish that we could.
Mom is not a victim. Mom is the perpetrator. She made incredibly selfish, poor decisions time and time again, and not ever with our best interest in mind. Every excuse that she has for the problems in her life is a lie. She often says the recession is to blame for her hard times, but the truth is that Mom got fired from jobs for stealing and for drinking on the job. This is not speculation. I know this for a fact, because our boss at 7-11 told me.
Even if Mom gets a pass for her bad behavior while she was drinking, she still continues to this day. Sheâ€™s manipulated me into doing all her dirty work and taking care of her every time she fucked up for my whole life. She should have been taking care of me, not the other way around. Did you know that one time Mom took money from me and I found out she turned around and sent that money to you while you here in college? Thatâ€™s a perfect example of her lies and manipulation. She told me she needed the money for bills. She gave it to you and took the credit. I would have happily given you the shirt off my back, but Mom wanted the praise and adoration.
I did so much and made so many sacrifices for you and Jamie, so that you might have it better than I did. I tried so hard to bring joy into your lives whenever I could. I never told you about the things I did in the shadows because I never wanted you to feel like a burden the way Mom made me feel like one. I just wanted your lives to be better, plain and simple, in any way I possibly could.
One example of this is moving out when I was 18. You told me that you felt I had abandoned you and Jamie. I moved out because Mom said the reason she was drinking so much and crying at night was because she didnâ€™t have her own room. She said, â€œHow can I be happy when I donâ€™t even have my own space to put things?â€ So I moved into a house where I slept on the couch and was the maid because I couldnâ€™t afford rent, just because I thought it would make your life better, Momâ€™s life better.
I scratched and saved for an entire year to buy a car while I was in Denver. I lived in a studio apartment with no furniture and bed bugs. When you called and said Papa was sick and needed to go to the hospital in Nashville, I spent all that money to buy a plane ticket that night because you sounded so scared. You said you had exams that week. I was happy to do it, and I would do it again. But thatâ€™s another example of putting the needs of the family before my own. Did you know Dad would have died? He was hours away from dying when we got there the doctors said. Dad should have just gone to the regular ER. It shouldnâ€™t have been our problem to figure out.
I did my very best. I did the best I could for being only a child. It hurts so deeply to be cast aside by you girls. I know Iâ€™m not a perfect person. Iâ€™m painfully aware of that. But I do know that my heart is good and everything Iâ€™ve ever done came from a place of love and wanting better for you girls.
Iâ€™m not expressing these things to say anyone owes me anything. I just wish that you would try to understand. I wish that you wanted to understand.
When mom yelled at me at the table at Chiliâ€™s in Oklahoma, I could see it on your face: You got what was coming to you, Katy. Thatâ€™s what you get for upsetting Mom.Â And I just donâ€™t know how we got to that point. How did we come to the place where you feel I deserve to be verbally assaulted, rather than being upset with Mom for not being able to control herself? Sheâ€™s the parent. Sheâ€™s always been the parent. The punishment does not fit the crime. Was I being short with her? Yes. Did I deserve that response? No. But given the circumstance, I feel like I deserve some grace. I was still grieving Dad and Mom had foisted that whole mess onto me. Mom should have been handling all of that, but instead she called me crying, saying that they were going to throw Dadâ€™s ashes without us. She said she couldnâ€™t call you girls, that I had to do it. I had to call Uncle Terry because he â€œdidnâ€™t likeâ€ her and wasnâ€™t responding to her messages. It was all a bunch of bullshit. She just wanted me to do all the work, and so she played with my emotions so I would do her bidding. That whole situation with Jamie just straight up not answering me for months until 3 days beforeâ€¦ No one deserves that.
Mom has been meticulously trying to pit us against each other since we were little, because it shifts the blame off of her. Itâ€™s an abuse tactic called triangulation. Did you know every time Mom comes back from Florida, she calls me and talks trash about you and your family for hours? About Kyleâ€™s relationship with his dad, your relationship with Twila. The last time she did it, her opening statement was, â€œIâ€™m never going to Florida with them ever again!â€ I listen, and I let her vent, because thatâ€™s always been my role and whatâ€™s expected of me. I didnâ€™t know that this type of behavior is wildly inappropriate and abusive. Moms shouldnâ€™t be talking shit about their kids to their other kids. It breeds contempt.
I wrack my brain day in and day out trying to figure out what I did wrong and how I can fix it. I try desperately to show you my heart is good and I just want to love you. No matter what happens, I am your sister, and I will always be here for you. Iâ€™m open to hearing anything Iâ€™ve ever done that may have inadvertantly hurt you so I can make it right. I want our children to be friends and know each other. I want you to come out here and stay with me so we can get to know each other again and our kids can play in the backyard, and swim in my little pool. I want to be in your life, and I want you to be in mine. I want us to make new, beautiful memories. I want us to heal all this deep pain. I know itâ€™s possible, but I canâ€™t make you want it, too.
Â 
Love,
Your Sister Katy

Title: Promise me, Mama!
Content:
Last night something really dark settled in my body and mind.
My mother is a child abuser.
Iâ€™ve realized over the years that her behavior was abusive and incredibly damaging. I know that makes her an abuser, but my programming was still protecting her. I still wanted to believe it wasnâ€™t that badâ€“that she didnâ€™t realize what she was doing, or that she was struggling to love us in her own sick and twisted way.
Itâ€™s finally sinking in that she knew what she was doing was wrong, very, very wrong, because she taught me to hide it from a very young age. It was incredibly confusing.Â If you love me, why do we have to hide?Â I remember that being such a difficult thing to navigate. I was always in trouble. I didnâ€™t perceive my neglect as bad yet, as I was a child and had no frame of reference. I do recall negative feelingsâ€“loneliness, sadness, feelings of being violated. I didnâ€™t know which parts I wasnâ€™t supposed to tell about.
â€œI canâ€™t believe you said that!â€ or, â€œI canâ€™t believe you told her that!â€
I was constantly in trouble for saying the wrong thing, and I didnâ€™t know how to not say the wrong thing. I didnâ€™t know what the wrong things were.
The few â€œfriendsâ€ my mom had over the course of my childhood werenâ€™t usually around for very long. The only way my mom knows how to connect with people is through pity. My dad had lots of friends, and those friends had girlfriends. Usually what would happen is she would reel a kind woman in by telling stories of oppression and abuse. When I was a young child, my father was the perpetrator. She would have cigarettes on the porch with them, telling all the horrible things she had to endure, forcing her into depressive dysfunction. Well its no wonder you struggle raising your children under such conditions! How can I help?
These women had beautiful intentions, hoping to help my mother, who seemingly had no one, through a hard time. They would clean the house, smile and give me compliments. Tell me that Mama was just having a rough go, and sheâ€™d be okay. And then theyâ€™d just stop coming around. This was always supposedly because Dad had turned them against her.
She still says this. Recently she said she had to stop using Facebook because no one would talk to her because Dad had slandered her name. In reality itâ€™s because sheâ€™s creepy. She would comment on every single thing a person posted, and then reply to every single personâ€™s comment. Itâ€™s unnerving.
You canâ€™t tell my mom anything. She immediately becomes offended. I let my mom act this way on my Facebook for a long time as part of my never-ending quest to be a good and supportive daughter, even though it made me feel yucky. It wasnâ€™t just that her actions were embarrassing, it felt like she was hijacking my Facebook posts. It looked like she was showering me with affection that knew no bounds, so why did it feel like she didnâ€™t care about me? If I posted a selfie and there were 20 comments from my friends, there were 20 comments from her saying variations of, â€œThatâ€™s my gorgeous daughter!â€
Sheâ€™s lonely, I would tell myself. She doesnâ€™t mean any harm.
When it finally became too much, I got the courage to ask her politely to just reign it in a bit. She was offended, deeply hurt. I donâ€™t remember exactly what it said, but Iâ€™m sure it was something like, â€œIâ€™m so sorry for loving you too much. Iâ€™ll just disappear into the shadows, never to be heard from again!â€
She stopped for a few weeks, but then we was right back at it! I eventually just stopped using Facebook.
Actually, Iâ€™m going to see if I can find the conversation real quick.
11/14/17
Me: Hey Mom we have to set some Facebook boundaries. You canâ€™t comment on every single thing multiple times. Iâ€™m sorry but I donâ€™t want to unfriend you. I love you, butâ€¦ boundaries, okay? Youâ€™re coming on a little strong.
Mom: Okey dokey.
3/9/18
Me: Mom you gotta give me some space on the olâ€™ Facebook, okay? Itâ€™s not a good look for a 31 to have her mom commenting on everything. Iâ€™m happy for your support ğŸ™‚ Just calm down a little bit, okay? I love you. We need to work on setting healthy boundaries.
Mom: You will not hear from me again. Promise. Sorry for embarrassing you.

I had to take a break and come back, because thereâ€™s so much here.
Up until recently, I thought that saying I promise meant Iâ€™ll try my best. Content:

I remember thinking to myself, even if this is the honeymoon phase, if our love life is even just 10% of this for the rest of my life, Iâ€™d be very happy.
Physicality is very important to me. I donâ€™t mean just sex. Iâ€™m actually not a person that even really needs sex. Iâ€™ve never been a one night stand person. Itâ€™s the intimacy, the togethernessÂ important. What I need is to be touched. What I need is to be loved. If it feels empty, I canâ€™t do it.
One day it all just dried up, completely. Just completely went away. That was years ago.
Ever since then, Iâ€™ve been changing and bending myself in every way possible to earn that back from him. Iâ€™ve realized Iâ€™m doing the exact same thing I did with my mother, and every other adult relationship. Iâ€™m trying to earn someoneâ€™s love back.
When I try to talk to him about it, he puts all the blame on me. Iâ€™m the reason weâ€™re not physical anymore. He says, â€œwe can get back there, it just takes time.â€ Iâ€™ve stopped drinking. Iâ€™ve stopped going out. Iâ€™ve stopped expressing myself in ways that feel natural to me. Iâ€™m trying every day to be a good, calm, gentle wife and mother. Iâ€™m trying every day to be on my best behavior, in hopes that he might want me again. He says we donâ€™t do the things that used to make him attracted to me anymore and that Iâ€™ve done emotional damage that will â€œtake timeâ€.
I just donâ€™t know if I can do it much longer. I donâ€™t even know what that means, but I know that Iâ€™m exhausted. I literally have to beg him for just kisses. When I mention it, he turns into a robot and verbally compiles a list of all the kisses of the day, what time they were, how long they lasted. I wait for him to finish, and then all I can say is, no but you havenâ€™t kissed me. And he acts like he doesnâ€™t understand. It makes me feel crazy. Something doesnâ€™t make sense.
But I have to believe him. I just have to.
The first year we were together he used to hold me so tight, all night long. I thought, this is heaven. I can do this. Hereâ€™s a man who doesnâ€™t give a goddamn about PDA, and who wants to snuggle at night long.
Now I have to literally ask his permission to hug him at night.
Iâ€™m a person that needs to be touched, needs to be held. Some people donâ€™t like that. Some people donâ€™t care about that at all, but I do. I care a lot.
It feels like a chicken and the egg scenario. He says Iâ€™m angry and thatâ€™s a turn off, but Iâ€™m angry because heâ€™s not making love to me! I swear to God, if he would just give me some tenderness like once a week, my whole vibe would change. We had sex for 10 minutes in the middle of the night a few weeks ago and I was on cloud 9 for 3 whole days.
Itâ€™s a really horrible feeling to carry around this big weight, that Iâ€™m the problem. Itâ€™s my fault he doesnâ€™t want me. And Iâ€™m trying so hard to listen. Iâ€™m trying to hard comply. But I still feel like Iâ€™m getting it so wrong. I just donâ€™t know what to do anymore.
Iâ€™m so confused.
Was he ever that person or was it an act? How can you go from a waterfall to a tiny ice cream cone like that and just be cool with it. Does he not want intimacy, too? Did he ever, or was it a trick? I just canâ€™t understand how what Iâ€™ve done could be so bad that he can be fine with justâ€¦nothing. The weird thing is when I call it nothing, he pushes back and says the strangest things, like â€œI feel really close to you right now, closer than ever.â€ He tries to convince me that itâ€™s not nothing, that thereâ€™s something there, but it sure feels like nothing to me. Especially in comparison to how things were before.
Something isnâ€™t adding up. Something isnâ€™t right, here. Iâ€™ve been getting this gross feeling lately that maybe he was love bombing me. I donâ€™t want to think that about him. I canâ€™t think that about him. I canâ€™t go through that again. I canâ€™t live with that.
I moved to LA to live. I moved here to experience the weird and wonderful. I came here to feel alive. But here I am, a mother, all alone all the time in the suburbs, watching the baby while my husband achieves his goals and plays his video games and has band practice.
I think I have to let it go. I think I have to just do what I want to do. Itâ€™s going to be tiring. Iâ€™m going to have to do it all at night since I watch the baby all day every day, but I have to do it. I have to get my body strong, and I have to start fighting for the life I want in some way.
Michael wants me to be a streamer, to make videos. I honestly donâ€™t really want to, but it feels like the only creative outlet available to me as a mother. Iâ€™m really luke warm about making â€œcontentâ€, opening myself for the kids to shred me apart, for men to say gross things to me. I feel like he just wants me to stay in the house, where he knows where I am and what Iâ€™m doing. Sometimes I feel like a kept woman. Like I have to do every single thing within his parameters, or else. It feels like my parameters donâ€™t matter.
I donâ€™t know if he means to do it, but he messes with my head and makes me feel all flustered and confused. If he read the above paragraph, he would find a way to convince me that Iâ€™m free to do whatever I want, I just have to do it. But thatâ€™s not the truth, and Iâ€™m not smart enough to explain it to him.
During the pandemic, there were things I wanted to experienceâ€“once in a lifetime things. I couldnâ€™t believe I was living in LA, the epicenter of the riots, and I couldnâ€™t see them. I couldnâ€™t go to the marches. I couldnâ€™t celebrate with everyone in the streets when Biden won the election. We would fight and fight and fight about it and finally he would pull his trump cardâ€“if you get Corona and bring it into this house, I will die, and you will carry that around forever. So I complied. And I comply today.
I feel so confused sometimes because he feels very controlling, but he convinces me heâ€™s not. And I believe him. I accept that I had it all wrong. The world is mine for the taking and itâ€™s me thatâ€™s holding me back. Yet whenever something really important comes up, thereâ€™s always a problem. When we were in Nashville for my baby shower, he wouldnâ€™t leave the house with me. He always has a trump card. We saw a violent crime while we were there and he said he didnâ€™t want to go out because of that. How can you argue with that? You canâ€™t.
There was that whole thing with Bev and the hotel. He told me I was being an irresponsible mother by going. When I went to Kristinâ€™s birthday party, that was a huge problem. When I wanted to fly to Nashville to see my best friend and my family on my own, we argued about that for literal weeks. When I had my friends over to make cookies, that degraded into a horrible experience. The trip to Palm Springs for my birthday got so fucked up we ended up leaving a day early.
When we talk about these incidents, by the end of the conversation, he has it all worked out where Iâ€™m the problem. If I had just done XY and Z differently, things wouldnâ€™t have gone badâ€“his parameters. And by the end of the conversation, I believe him. I try to live in those parameters. A trip to Nashville gets changed into a visit from a friend to go to a hotel which turns into going to a friendâ€™s house for her birthday which turns into having people over at the house. Shave down, shave down, shave down, try to fit the parameters. But still somehow I always get it wrong, and Iâ€™m always in trouble. I did it wrong. And then heâ€™s distant for weeks. I have to earn it back.
Heâ€™s so smart and he thinks so fast, he really turns it on me. I believe he has my best interest at heart, so I succumb. Iâ€™ll be better next time. Iâ€™ll do it different next time. It doesnâ€™t feel right. It feels like I have to just stay home and be quiet, never get angry, never get sad. I have to beg people to drive out here to visit me, and eventually they stop coming.
I have a son now, and I would never sell him short. Never. So I have to start fighting for my life. I have to start going and doing things at night that make me feel alive. I have to make my body stronger. I have to make my mind stronger. No more sitting around waiting and hoping he might fuck me, he might kiss me. If Iâ€™m just good enough. Am I good enough?

Title: I want good memories.
Content:
Okay, Iâ€™m back. Iâ€™ve had a really hard time the last few days.
Itâ€™s really sinking for me that I donâ€™t have any happy memories. Theyâ€™re very few. All my memories are tainted. Every good memory is linked to 20 bad ones. Thatâ€™s why I canâ€™t get any relief in my mind. I canâ€™t go to anyone for true comfort.
I realized that my threshold for pain is so high, that Iâ€™ve been hurting people around me without even realizing it. Itâ€™s like giving someone a paper cut. Sometimes it physically knocks me to my knees and I have to go outside and hold onto the grass and wait for it to pass. With that, Iâ€™m starting to feel the little things. Iâ€™d made myself so numb.
I feel pathetic. I feel like a waste of space. I feel like a failure. I feel unlovable.
Iâ€™ve been hurting Michael.
When we first got together, I tried so hard to push him away. I was trying to save him from me. But he persisted. He kept coming back. So I resigned myself to the fact that any hurt he gets, he asked for it. God thatâ€™s so fucked up.
I remember thinking Iâ€™m going to absolutely destroy this guy.
Not intentionally, of course. The last conversation I had with my ex husband, he said, â€œI truly wish I had never met you.â€ I hadnâ€™t yet processed leaving him, and then my breakup with Lindsey, if you can call it thatâ€“it was more of a get-away, an escape. One of the last things Lindsey said to me was, â€œYou are so fucked in the head.â€
I see now that I act out for negative attention. Being neglected as a child, that was the only way I could get my momâ€™s attention, was to throw a fit basically. When I was angry, she looked at me. Content:

You couldnâ€™t go to the bar or to the bathroom, it was really that ass-to-elbow. So we stuck it out like champs and made friends with the people around us. Though the show did eventually start, at about 1:30 I turned to the girls and was likeâ€¦â€ yâ€™all, I canâ€™t do this anymore.â€ And they laughed and let out a huge breath and said, â€œUS TOO! Letâ€™s get the fuck out of here!â€
So we walked next door and had a margarita on the patio before we all headed home.
Call me old fashioned, but you just canâ€™t make people stand in the exact same spot for 3 hours before the show starts. Thatâ€™s ludicrous! Iâ€™ve been to many shows of all kinds. I worked at a music venue for 10 years. If youâ€™re gonna pack the house so tight that no one can move around and the bar and bathroom are inaccessible, you gotta get the dang show on the road, people! When I worked at the venue, doors opened at whatever time and show usually started an hour after. Doors at 9, show at 10.
Well, itâ€™s a shame we didnâ€™t see Trixie, but I still had a really great time with my friends and I know itâ€™s something weâ€™ll laugh about for years.
The next day Mina came over and helped me with something Iâ€™ve been putting off for yearsâ€“going through all my clothes. I have SO much clothes! I have a ton of really special vintage items, but I also have a lot of clothes from my anorexic-cocaine days when I was an obscene size 4. Iâ€™ve been holding on to those for too long. Then the rest of my regular clothes were packed up because I couldnâ€™t wear them while I was pregnant. So I needed to pull those out, sort them, and pack up my maternity clothes. It was a feat! But we got most of it done.
It made me realize how important it is to ask for help, and just how important help really is. I donâ€™t have any help. I donâ€™t mean that in a self-pity way. I mean it quite literally. My father has passed. Iâ€™ve gone no-contact with my abusive mother, as a result my siblings are not speaking to me, and because I moved here right before the pandemic, I donâ€™t have any social support. Also, Michaelâ€™s parents are not in the picture, really either. His father is unstable and his mother is a basket case if Iâ€™m quite honest. The two times sheâ€™s come over itâ€™s been pure chaos. She says she wants to come over more but she has anxiety about driving and is â€œsickâ€ a lot. ğŸ¤” Itâ€™s really just the two of us.
When you throw my disability into the mix, itâ€™s really hard. It takes a big toll on us. Itâ€™s almost impossible to make plans because itâ€™s hard to know if Iâ€™ll be having a pain flair up that day or not. I have to take things one day at a time. When my body feels good, I do stuff. When it doesnâ€™t, I donâ€™t.
Itâ€™s hard on me mentally when the chores pile up and the house gets into disarray. The clutter activates my anxiety and I kind of freeze up.
Iâ€™ve learned through therapy that the reason this happens is because my brain has been conditioned in a way that makes decision making hard. When I was little, I was always in trouble. My mom projected all her pain and anger onto me, so any decision I made was always the wrong one and I got yelled at. Even when I tried to do something helpful like clean the house, I always ended up getting yelled at because I did it wrong. Thatâ€™s why today even making the smallest decisions can debilitate me. My brain thinks that no matter what choice I make, thereâ€™s going to be dire consequences, so it doesnâ€™t let me make any as a kind of form of protection. Iâ€™m working through this and it is getting better, and it was so nice to have Mina there with me because she helped me make those choices and also she understands anxiety. She didnâ€™t push me or make us go too fast, and she respected my weird requests about things to keep it all organized in my mind so I didnâ€™t get overwhelmed.
When I write about my anxiety, my negative thinking kicks in and I tell myself that Iâ€™m pathetic. Learning more and more about CPTSD is helping me so much. I understand why I do the things I do, and I understand why I react the way I do to those things. I know that inner voice telling me Iâ€™m pathetic is my motherâ€™s voice, not my own, so I can welcome it and let it dissipate instead of internalizing it and really taking it to heart.

Title: Toy Story 2 and the Vulnerable Narcissist
Content:
I just watched Toy Story 2 with my son and I was really taken back by the Prospector.
The Prospector is the villain of the story, but, as with all covert narcissists, you donâ€™t know until the very end. You donâ€™t realize until itâ€™s too late. The covert narcissist disguises themselves until thereâ€™s nothing to lose. Every action he takes is self serving disguised in a cloak of selflessness.
To summarize, the main character, Woody, has friends, a beautiful life and network at home that he gets stolen away from. In his new environment he makes new friends who reveal that not only is he part of a famous TV show, but heâ€™s the star and theyâ€™ve been waiting for him for their whole lives to complete â€œthe setâ€ so they can be on display and come out of storage, which has been a decades long, torturous experience for them. Thus begins the manipulation.
The first thing The Prospector does is plays on Woodyâ€™s ego. He doesnâ€™t even have to say much. He opens a huge door with all this incredible and vast memorabilia. This is classic love bombing, and it works for a time. It would have been ultimately successful if heâ€™d been able to keep Woody isolated, another common narc abuse tactic.
When Woodyâ€™s friends show up unexpectedly, they remind him of his former life. They ask him to come home, and Woody declines. They respect his decision, which on a personal note, I was surprised by. My programming expected them to try and influence his decision, but they just â€¦ didnâ€™t. Buzz accepted his decision, respected it, and walked away.
After a few moments, Woody remembers his sense of self, which is very well established. He changes his mind and decides to go home.
This sets into motion the Narcissistâ€™s next move â€” the guilt trip. He convinces Woody to speak to one of the other toys before leaving. She explains she had a life just like his, but it ended, and so will his. Not only that, but if he lives, they will essentially be condemned to death in the black void of the storage unit. Unable to bear the guilt and uncertainty of the future, Woody decides to stay.
The Prospector uses another classic tactic here, which is fear mongering. â€œItâ€™s a dangerous world out there,â€ he says at one point. This is coupled with sewing seeds of self-doubt: â€œYou wonâ€™t last a second out there.â€
Despite every effort, when Woody still ultimately decides to go home, The Prospector reveals his true self, as thereâ€™s no longer any benefit to his facade. The Prospector is the only toy still in his original box. He reveals that heâ€™s not actually confined to his box as he lead everyone to believe. This is a classic narcissist move: perceived helplessness and victimhood. By making himself look weaker than the others, heâ€™s able to pull the strings undetected. Itâ€™s also during this time that the vulnerability of his narcissism is revealed. He is jealous of the other toys because they were all chosen over him at one time, hence why he is the only one still in his box. We discover his motives are more sinister and complex than previously understood. At first the motive seems clear: to not go back into storage. But now we know itâ€™s not that simple. The Prospector wants the other toys to actually suffer. He is driven by not only a need to control, but by jealousy.
Okay, so that ends the summary.
Because this is all so fresh for me, Iâ€™m having a serious issue with everything being triggering. Literally everything. When I see something on TV with brothers and sisters getting along or doing something nice for each other, it takes me to a deeply sad place. I have a photo of me as a baby on the fridge, and almost every time I look at it I have some sort of flashback. I tried to watch an episode of Supernanny and I got triggered because the mother called on her 12 year old son to come and discipline the younger child. All I could think was, one day that little sibling is going to hate the older one, just like mine do. Flashbacks on flashbacks on flashbacks.
Even something as seemingly safe as watching a Pixar movie with my infant sonâ€¦ surprise! Triggering.
So this really rocked me today. It affected me because it all ended happily. Woody had supportive friends who fought for him. The people around him realized The Prospector was in fact the villain, and joined him in leaving the toxic situation. The Prospector got what he deserved and everything ended up beautifully.
Now imagine if The Prospector was your mother. The Prospector is mine. There was no opportunity to develop a sense of self, no support network. Just a lifetime of confusion, pain and isolation.

Title: The Inner Children
Content:
Okay, so I donâ€™t know anything about inner child work. I hear about it constantly. But from what little I understand, thereâ€™s more than just â€œthe inner childâ€ but itâ€™s actually inner children, aka different versions of yourself from your development that had different needs.
Iâ€™m very excited to understand this more because right now, when people say â€œnurture your inner childâ€ Iâ€™m likeâ€¦ what the fuck does that even mean? How? I canâ€™t hug an invisible 5 year old. And even if I could, what good would that do? Re-parent myself? What in the actual hell does that even really actually mean? It sounds like gibberish to me. I understand that itâ€™s not, but I donâ€™t get itâ€¦Â yet.
I definitely understand a few of my inner children though. Like, thereâ€™s 6-8 year old me who is just super lonely and scared and confused and just so, so extremely sad. And thereâ€™s 15 year old me who is just furious and destructive and wants to hurt everything including herself because sheâ€™s in so much pain and feels so helpless. Then thereâ€™s early 20â€™s me who just wanted to do her own thing but was always being pulled in a different direction and persuaded to do things she didnâ€™t want to do.
That being saidâ€¦ I made a diary entry in the middle of the night last night where I allowed myself to express some really ugly, angry, judgmental thoughts. I was scared to write it, and I actually even edited some of the ugliest parts out.
I am not an ugly person. Iâ€™m extremely empatheticâ€“to a fault. So when I have really angry, nasty thoughts like that, I get angry at myself. I beat myselfÂ up. I feel disgusting.
I watched a YouTube video about recovering from narcissistic parental abuse that encouraged me to journal and explore the side of myself that believes the horrible things that I was taught to think about myself. At first I was like, hell no that sounds fucking horrible. The lady in the video said almost exactly that, but she said the reason I still have thoughts like that is because thereâ€™s an inner child that wants to be heard, so you should let that child speak so she can go away.
I did not do that exactly, but it did inspire me to allow myself to write the diary entry Iâ€™m describing.
The point of all this is that I felt really bad for about a day, but now I feel so much better than I did before. I feel so relieved, and I also feel confident that I donâ€™t actually, truly feel that way in my heart. Thatâ€™s why itâ€™s so awful when thoughts like that come into my head, because my soul is likeâ€¦ What is this?? Stop it! But they donâ€™t stop. Even worse, when I try to push them away and condemn myself, my anger just comes out in different ways.
So the point of this post isâ€¦ I think those thoughts belong to my 15 year old inner child.
Itâ€™s hard to describe how I felt when I was 15 except for rage. Thatâ€™s the age I realized really how horrific my motherâ€™s actions were. Thatâ€™s when I started to realize that every excuse she gave me for her neglect and abuse was a scam, because when all those things went away, then all of a sudden there was a whole slew of new excuses. My whole life up until that point my mother had blamed my father for her behavior. The neglect was so severe, sometimes she wouldnâ€™t come out of her room for entire days. We ate Kraft mac and cheese for dinner out of the pot every night for dinner if we were lucky. As a little girl, it wasnâ€™t uncommon for me to go to school with greasy hair, dirt under my fingernails, underwear that Iâ€™d worn for two weeks straight.
Even though we were taken away when I was 11, when I came back things didnâ€™t get better. She just got better at hiding it. She got better at teaching us how to act and what to say.
And she blamed all this on dad. â€œYour father makes me drink,â€ she would say through sobs. Your father makes me drink.
Your father this, your father that. It got to the point that in my 8th grade year, I was literally begging my own mother to leave my father. But when she finally did, things didnâ€™t get better. They got worse. Much, much worse.
So, as a young teenager I realized all at once that not only was my mom full of shit, but now my Dadâ€“my best friendâ€“was gone, too. And I never got any sleep. When dad was gone, Mom cried all night long. All. Night. Long. And when Dad came to stay for a few weeks, they would argue all night long. All. Night. Long.
I was angry. I was sooo, so angry. I can feel it now. It feels like a hot coal in my stomach and climbs up through my face and then my limbs, and my chest gets tight.
Realizing the person I loved and trusted the most was a fraud made my entire reality collapse. I was filled with rage and judgement.
And I just fucking hated everything.Â Everything and everyone.
So thatâ€™s where I think a lot of those feelings were coming from. I know theyâ€™ll come again. When they do, Iâ€™m going to let them out here, where itâ€™s safe.
The doctor on YouTube said 15 year old me is crying out to be heard, so Iâ€™m going to let her speak.

Title: Maybe I should hate you for this
Content:
Wow. Remember Taking Back Sunday? Do you, though? I sure do.
I saw a meme on instagram that showed a bar setup with the words â€œI just wanna break you down so badly.â€ If there was ever a meme for a 36 year old woman who was an emo kid who grew up to be a bartender and 20 years later is scrolling instagram for relatable contentâ€¦ there it was.
Anyways, it made me go into Spotify and find that original Taking Back Sunday record that we were all obsessed with. My god were we obsessed.
You know, I never realized that the whole emo thing was a really specifically midwest thing. I canâ€™t talk about it at all to Michael. His was a different experience out here in California. But for those of us in the rust belt when we were 15-16 years old, this record was everything. For those of us who lived in the gray skies, blistering winds, digging our cars out of the snow, our parents were still poor even though they both worked full time jobs. My foster mom was an X ray tech, and my foster dad was a â€¦ fuck what was he? An electrician or something. Something that sucks the life out of your body so when you come home all you can do is sit in your recliner while your teenage kids run rampant. But it was the same story for all of us in that Detroit suburb. We were all painfully unsupervised. We split into two groups, the emo kids and the jugglos in about 2001.
Iâ€™ll never forget when my friend Stacy first told me about Insane Clown Posse. She was so excited. It was Halloween in 9th grade. She said she went to a show where everyone sprayed Fargo and painted their faces like clowns and I was like.. yeah Iâ€¦ no. Itâ€™s a no from me, there. But we stayed friends. I was friends with a lot of jugglos actually. Mostly because they were misunderstood from what I saw. They were poor kids from broken homes looking for something just like I was. So I went the hardcore kid-emo direction. It was more sensitive and artistic, in my opinion. Thereâ€™s an intellectualism missing from the ICP-twiztid thing. Anyways, Iâ€™m literally from the same town as ICP, so no one can tell me shit about it. I literally lived it. I saw it emerge from the shadows.
Anyway, I remember Mitch Wojcikâ€“what a cool nameâ€“he really smashed this record into our brains. He brought a silver burned CD with big black marker boy-writing on it.
I miss that basement. So smokey, so dark, so perfect. We all loved each other and accepted each other back then.
Whoa.
Something weird just happened.
I feel the living death, but itâ€™s warm.
Yeah. There was something about the togetherness back then. Everything was so bleak. No jobs. No homes. Gray sky. Crumbling skyscrapers. Feet and feet of white and brown snow. Our cars were old pieces of shit that smelled like grandpaâ€™s cigarettes, but they took us places, by god, and they took us places together. We would cram in the back seats 5 at a time, giggling. And we didnâ€™t have much, but Mitch brought over a burned CD for us all. Do you know what I mean? Itâ€™s such a hard thing to explain. There were no police. There was no money. Our parents were burnt. But we really had each other. We made something out of nothing. We organized our own shows. We were autonomous. Jakefest. VFW halls. Paper fliers on neon colored paper. So many cigarettes. Handmade screen printed shirts. All you needed was a ride and $5.
For a few hours it felt like what Christmas should feel like. We forgot it was cold outside. We all recognized each other from the different townships, like distant cousins. No phones. No instagram. No bullying. Just pure fuckinâ€™ kids doing art for other kids because we had nothing else. Truly nothing else.

No, this is what weâ€™re doing. Donâ€™t make any problems. Donâ€™tÂ embarrass me. Stop being so selfish!
Years and years of thisâ€“I finally cracked.
It seems so obvious, yet here I am at 5 in the morning wonderingâ€¦ was I being selfish? Maybe I was being selfish. Because now I have nothing. I have no one. I didnâ€™t understand the trade off. I had to accept things the way they were. I should have accepted them. I was provided for, loved, understood. I couldnâ€™t go to the beachâ€¦ but I couldnâ€™t go to the beach! So I burned it all down.
This is a specific example but itâ€™s an allegory for my whole life. Another example is when we went to Miami. I didnâ€™t pay a dime. We had backstage passes, vip, all expenses paid. All my friends were there. We had a blast. But I wanted to see Fedde Le Grande one morning. Just one act, just one. Please? Please?? Itâ€™s right there! Iâ€™ll be back in an hour, I said. Fucking stop it. Donâ€™t embarrass me! He said. So I burned it down.
Letâ€™s be clear, I was well behaved. I didnâ€™t do anything in Miami, or in Panama City with the family. What I mean when I say I burned it down is one day I just.. left. I just packed all my things, threw away what I couldnâ€™t fit in my car, and I just left. I came to Los Angeles.
Iâ€™ll find people who love me as much, if not more. Like-minded people who love art and music and donâ€™t use the N word. Iâ€™ll find a new partner who doesnâ€™t belittle me, ignore me.
But I havenâ€™t, and I wonâ€™t. I wonâ€™t ever again.
I canâ€™t shake this feeling that I had it all yet I wanted more. I struck silver and thought I could just as easily strike gold.
What am I trying to sayâ€¦
Iâ€™m trying to say that Iâ€™m starving.
I feel like Iâ€™m dying. I feel like Iâ€™m losing my mind.
My friendsâ€¦ my god I had so many friends. So many beautiful friends. People who were beautiful, abitious, humorous, smart, witty. Donâ€™t get me wrong, theyâ€™re still my friends, but theyâ€™re 2000 miles away. They canâ€™t just come over for a Tuesday night bonfire. They canâ€™t meet me for margaritas on the patio. We canâ€™t meet at the river or at the Mercy Lounge.
My husband is such a kind soul. But heâ€™s so different from me. He doesnâ€™t understand me at all. And I realized tonight that he doesnâ€™t really know me. He doesnâ€™t know who I was before the grief of losing my father. When I was young and my hips still worked. He doesnâ€™t laugh at the things I laugh at. I donâ€™t know how he really feels. I canâ€™t feel him.
I could feel my ex husband. Thatâ€™s why the bad times hurt so much. And I guess thatâ€™s why the good times felt so good. He was adventurous like me. We had the same dark sense of humor. We were silly together.
Itâ€™s a horrible and embarrassing thing to compare husbands past and present. I wish I didnâ€™t do it. But I do.
Sometimes he and I would pull the mattress out of the bedroom into the living room and just watch TV for 2 days straight, shut the world out together. We called it Baby Day. I know how fucking dumb that sounds but he was my baby and I was his and thatâ€™s why we called it that. Iâ€™ll never forget one of the last things he said to me. The world is shut down. Itâ€™s Baby Day forever.Â A plea to come home. But I didnâ€™t go home to him.
I stayed here. I wanted more for myself. I wanted better.
Butâ€¦ I hate to say these words. I really hate to say these words. I didnâ€™t find better. I feel like I moved laterally. My husband treats me like an angel. But he feels like a stranger to me. He doesnâ€™t see me.
I feel so alone. My life before was so rich with experience, adventure, love, camaraderie. But it wasnâ€™t juuuuust right. So I burned it down.
I feel â€¦ like I was a fool. I feel like .. I donâ€™t know, likeâ€¦ how dare I? What an arrogant piece of shit I was, that I thought I deserved better. Better than what? A loving, beautiful family? A fleet of wonderful friends? Why, because I didnâ€™t get to go to see Fedde le Grande? I didnâ€™t get to go to the beach? I didnâ€™t get to wear what I wanted to? I didnâ€™t get to â€¦ what?
One time we saw My Morning Jacket together. We watched silently. At the same time halfway through the set, we looked at each other, tears in our eyes, at the exact same time, moved in the exact same feels at the same time during the same song. We kissed and held hands for the rest of the set as the sun went down and the sky turned pink.
So many memories like that.
Juxtaposed with memories of feeling so small, so unimportant, so wrong.
Now I have the supportive husband I dreamed of, but at what cost? My soul feels like itâ€™s dying.
I feel like a shell.
I feel like nothing.
Iâ€™m not moved to make art anymore. Iâ€™m not moved to do anything anymore. I donâ€™t laugh. I force my smile. Tomorrow, I tell myself. Iâ€™ll do it tomorrow.
Maybe when my son is older heâ€™ll want to do adventures with me. Maybe heâ€™ll want to drive 3 hours just to see flowers in the desert, or try some wild foreign food at a shadowy hole-in-the-wall. Maybe heâ€™ll want to â€¦ But what a sad thought. That Iâ€™ll have to wait 10 years, suffering in stagnation.
The only other person who understood me was my father. I miss him so much. Fuck I miss him. We used to drive to New York City and take the backroads the whole way. One time we got lost and saw a huge rainbow on top of a mountain in Pennsylvania.
Now I just sit here. I just sit in this house. I have no friends. I have no family. Just me, my husband, and my beautiful son. Heâ€™s too small. Going to the grocery store is a feat in itself. My every waking moment is devoted to him, and happily. But something deep in my soul needs more. And itâ€™s driving me crazy. Iâ€™m just alone with my thoughts all the time. Constantly. All these thoughts and rumination, on and on and on, against the same back drop day in and day out.
Itâ€™s a beautiful backdrop. We have a lovely little home. But itâ€™s so far away from anything. I feel like I traded a small-town-city for an even smaller town city, if that makes any sense.
Once Papa died, the tiny threads holding me my mom and my sisters together started to unravel. Evaporate, really, if Iâ€™m honest.
You know, my mom called me one day in a panic and said she was scared my uncle Terry had thrown my dadâ€™s ashes already without us. If he hasnâ€™t already, heâ€™s going to soon, she said. So I immediately called my sisters, started planning, did my best. I picked a weekend that worked for everyone. My littlest sister didnâ€™t answer me until 3 days before the memorial, yet I learned today that she complained I picked the hotels without anyones input. Firstly, I didnâ€™t pick the hotels. Mother did. But she told them I picked the hotels. Either way, who fucking cares? My sister didnâ€™t return my calls for 2 entire months, yet somehow Iâ€™m the bad guy because I made decisions? Make it make sense.
Yet still here I sit, wondering am I bad? Did I do it all wrong? Maybe I am just a selfish asshole because I wanted a husband who didnâ€™t hurt me, because I wanted a memorial for my father with my family in attendance.
I donâ€™t really know the point Iâ€™m trying to make. Thatâ€™s the whole point, really. I canâ€™t make my life make sense. I canâ€™t get un-confused. I donâ€™t know how much a body is expected to put up with. Is abuse just part of life and I just havenâ€™t figured that out yet?
I donâ€™t fucking know.
All I know is that about twice a week I want to kill myself.
Not like actually kill myself, but.. kind of. I imagine walking into traffic. I imagine going to sleep and not waking up.
I wanted to make my head spin less yet here it is spinning even faster than it ever was and now I have no one and nothing to hold on to.

Title: Exploring unwanted thoughts

Title: You have such a big heart, baby.
Content:

repeating yourself to an emotionally immature person doesnâ€™t work. They are only willing to see whatâ€™s helpful for them. Invoking self-awareness can be harmful to a person who thrives on blaming others.

Iâ€™ve never been afraid of that, because I know that I never had any intention of hurt, but because everyone has their own outlook on life, that doesnâ€™t mean Iâ€™m not capable of hurting someone inadvertently.
To me, this is just inherent knowledge. I didnâ€™t have to learn this. So the idea that some people do have to learn it is very eye-opening for me.

I truly cannot understand why she wouldnâ€™t want to know that information. Why would she tell me Iâ€™m misremembering or I have a problem with my mind? Why would she chose to damage me further? Furthermore, this is all based on the assumption that she hurt me on accident. Because I donâ€™t have this capacity on my own, itâ€™s almost impossible for me to entertain the idea that my mother did these things knowingly and with the intention of hurt.

Title: Cassandra Syndrome
Content:
My husband has Autism.
He is thoughtful, kind, driven. He is gentle, listens, takes care of things around the house. He is an incredible father.
Yet I feel so lonely.
Itâ€™s so incredibly hard to explain. When we first started dating, he was overly affectionate, embarrassingly so. I was never personally embarrassed, but it was over the top in such a way that I knew someone other than myself might find it embarrassing. People would stare at us when we were in public when he would randomly smash his face into mine and give me a huge, long kiss. We made love every day, twice a day. Our sex life was exciting. We tried different things all the time. He was afraid of nothing.
The one day it all went away. All of it. Just *poof* gone.
That was years ago.
Sometimes I wake up crying and I have to come into the living room and hold and rock myself. Sometimes he comes out and asks whatâ€™s wrong. I tell him, â€œyou donâ€™t kiss me. you donâ€™t caress me. you donâ€™t want me. I want to feel wanted. I want to feel desired. We used to make out all the time.â€ But he doesnâ€™t hear me. He responds with robotic recaps of every kiss we shared over the last week: â€œAt 2:15pm on Tuesday we kissed for exactly 3.4 seconds. At 5:26 on Saturday I kissed you three times when I came home from work. I always kiss you before I kiss our son because I read somewhere that itâ€™s important I show you affection before the child so you never feel secondary.â€
What does one say to that?
One time the pain was so great I was curled in a ball barely able to breathe. When he asked whatâ€™s wrong, I said, â€œYou never touch me. You donâ€™t hold me. I need to feel your touch. I need you to hug me.â€ And rather than scoop me up and hold me tight, he just stared at me blankly and started taking steps backwards towards the door.
I donâ€™t want to use the word, but I feel like heâ€™s gaslighting me. He always says, â€œSoon,â€ or, â€œItâ€™s getting better.â€ But heâ€™s been saying that for years. Weâ€™ve had sex a few times, but it was quick and empty. I say, â€œWe havenâ€™t had sex in literal years.â€ He says, â€œWe had sex three weeks ago in the shower.â€ I want to spit. I want to set the house on fire. I want to smash the television. But I donâ€™t. I nod and say, â€œYes, yes we did. Youâ€™re right,â€ because I donâ€™t want to scare him off.
He takes great care of me. I donâ€™t have to work, all my bills are paid, anything I needâ€“done, he does it with a smile and promptly. I feel like a monster to complain. He says, â€œI have no more to give.â€
All this time, I thought we were trying to get back to where we were before, but Iâ€™m coming to realize that will never happen, because it wasnâ€™t real. He was masking. Sex with me was a special interest, and heâ€™s now lost that interest. Itâ€™s like him with food. Heâ€™ll become obsessed with a certain brand and flavor of sparkling water, drink only that for several months, and then one day, just stop completely. Now itâ€™s Dr. Pepper, only Dr. Pepper. He will not drink anything else, unless itâ€™s a 20 oz bottle of Mugâ€™s root beerâ€“no cans, no 2 liters, it must be a 20 oz and it must be Mugâ€™s.
Sometimes he gets up with the baby and when the baby naps, he naps as well. I wake up and come out into the living room and find him on the couch. Why is he on the couch? Why didnâ€™t he crawl back in bed with me? I miss him so much.
We eat the same 4 safe dinners every night, because itâ€™s all heâ€™ll eat. I want shrimp scampi. â€œThatâ€™s okay, babe, Iâ€™ll just order Chik-fil-a,â€ he says with a smile, completely unbothered. I donâ€™t want to cook a delicious, fresh shrimp scampi dinner and eat it alone while you eat fast food. Why doesnâ€™t he understand that? Itâ€™s so lonely.
I donâ€™t feel any passion or romance from him. When I try to explain that, he goes off on his lists: Hereâ€™s an example of a time I gave you a compliment at exactly 7:13 on Tuesday night. He literally said this to me the other day: â€œI touched your butt twice in the kitchen yesterday.â€ Ok, cool, thanks! Got it! Oh my gosh, how silly of me! You did touch my butt exactly twice yesterday. Thumbs up!
That thing we had before, itâ€™s not going to come back.
Everything I read about women married to neuro-divergent men married to neuro-typical women is so bleak. The tips and tricks read like this:

Appreciate the freedom you have with your Aspie! He wonâ€™t mind at all if you leave every day and go do your own thing!
Learn to love having the bed all to yourself!
Good luck! ğŸ™‚

Thereâ€™s a term for what Iâ€™m experiencing and itâ€™s called Cassandra Syndrome. Itâ€™s spot on. Feelings of deep emptiness, feeling undeserving of love, feeling crazy, insomnia (I write this at 4:15 in the morning because I couldnâ€™t sleep anymore). Iâ€™ve never had insomnia before. I thought it was because of the baby, but itâ€™s not.
The worst part is he thinks itâ€™s all because of my childhood trauma.
I have to find us a marriage counselor who specializes in this area, so thatâ€™s what Iâ€™ll be doing all this week.
In the meantime, Iâ€™m just going to shut up about it and keep it inside because when I try to talk to him about it, he shuts down and gets all mopey for a week and what little crumbs of affection I was receiving from him dries up even further, and I just canâ€™t take that.
What I want to do is wake him up right now and tell him to have sex with me. Just do it. Just fucking do it, please, please God. Please. Please just make love to me. Pleaseâ€¦ but I know that wonâ€™t work. Weâ€™ll just end up in a repeat of the same 3 hour conversational cycle that ends with me apologizing and us getting nowhere.
Itâ€™s hard to keep my chin up. Iâ€™m an interesting, funny, fascinating woman, yet he doesnâ€™t laugh at or get my jokes. I feel uninteresting to him. Iâ€™m beautiful, sexy, but not to him. Iâ€™m lively. I love the world. Iâ€™m not boring! But he doesnâ€™t want to go anywhere or do anything with me. I managed to get him to a sushi restaurant a few weeks ago but it took so much begging and he just couldnâ€™t wait to leave. Yet thatâ€™s not how he recalls it. â€œWe had a nice time!â€ he says.
And now the guilt sets in. I feel so guilty for feeling this way because I know he really does try. But I just canâ€™t shake this feeling that itâ€™s his world and Iâ€™m just living in it. If I want to spend time with him, it has to be while heâ€™s doing something heâ€™s interested in.
Heâ€™s so mature in some ways, yet so immature in others. He doesnâ€™t connect with other adults. When we have people over, theyâ€™re children, his students. I spend all day talking to a literal baby, and in the evenings, Iâ€™m having conversations with literal children while he plays video games over the Twitch stream.
Iâ€™m dying inside. I need to live! And whatâ€™s worse, is when I want to go do things, he gets very uncomfortable. He just wants me to sit at home and paint and write while he reads and plays video games and we eat the same 4 dinners every day over and over and over and over and over and over.
This is my life now. I have a child with him. I cannot leave. And the guilt, god the guilt! I want to be enjoyed. I want to enjoy! I want to laugh! I want to cuddle! I want to ride a motorcycle to the mountains just to see the snow and turn around and come back. I want to go to the desert and fuck on the flowers. I want to eat octopus. I want to be able to buy everything we need at one grocery store, instead of going to 3 so I can get all the specific brands and flavors he must have. I want to have a day where the 3 of us just stay in bed all day and eat snacks and watch movies where heâ€™s not constantly on his phone or just plain restless. I want him to touch my face. I want him to wake me up and say, â€œget your bathing suit on babe, weâ€™re going to the beach today!â€ I want him to not look relieved when I say Iâ€™m going to take Michael Wayne with me to run errands. I want to feel the wind on my face. I want us to go to flea markets and farmers markets, for us to get ice cream and hear music. When we try to do things like that, heâ€™s disengaged, constantly looking around and popping his thumbs in and out of their sockets nervously (itâ€™s an incredibly unsettling tick he has any time we go out in public.)
Sigh.
I have to figure out how to make peace with this, because itâ€™s not going to change. Heâ€™s not going to wake up one day and be neuro-typical.
I wasnâ€™t able to know these things about him because of the Pandemic. I thought he was just being cautious because of the virus.
And thatâ€™s my fault, ultimately. I should have had the wisdom to wait and see, but I didnâ€™t. My biological clock was ticking down, not to mention my disability gets worse by the day. I picked him because I knew he would be a good father and husband. Loyal, dependable, hard working, patient, kind. Those were the things that mattered most to me. I thought once the Pandemic was over, the other things would come naturally. I had no idea it was even possible that it would be this bad. I thought, even if he doesnâ€™t love going out, still everyone needs to go out once in a while, donâ€™t they? I just didnâ€™t understand that for a rare sub-sect of people thatâ€™s simply not the case. As a naturally adventurous person myself, Iâ€™m not at all unfamiliar with the fact that most people just arenâ€™t as adventurous as I am, but I never for one second thought that it was possible for a person to be completely happy doing the exact same thing the exact same way over and over every single day. I never knew a person could eat exactly 2 kind bars for breakfast, Indian food for lunch, and chick-fil-a for dinner every single day for years and never, ever get tired of it. I never knew a person could play the same video game for 2 years straight, and not only not get tired of it, but watch other people play it when he canâ€™t play it. Every day. Every single day.
I believe variety is the spice of life. Thatâ€™s why I moved here.
He tells me that I am this way because of my trauma, that I crave instability because I had such a chaotic upbringing. But thatâ€™s not entirely true. In fact, my family resented my zest for life. Not my father, bless him. He understood. I miss him every day. But back to the point, I feel he uses this as a way to deflect. I feel like he wants me to become boring. Isnâ€™t that just an awful shame? The world is just filled to the brim with dull, boring people, and here I am, vivacious, exciting and excited, and in love with life, and he just doesnâ€™t value that.
What a predicament.

Title: Stop and go, off and onâ€¦
Content:

Sometimes I hate my family and I never want to speak to them again. I feel so certain about this that I believe itâ€™s done and Iâ€™ll never have to think about it again.
